parameters.name: key.deviceId
parameters.description: device_id is the serial number of the device

parameters.name: time
parameters.description:
Time indicates the time for which you are interested in the data.
If no time is given, the server will use the time at which it makes the request.

softwareImageComplianceCode.description: software_image_compliance_code is the compliance code for images.

terminattrComplianceCode.description: terminattr_compliance_code is the compliance code for TerminAttr.

extensionsComplianceCode.description: extensions_compliance_code is the compliance code for extensions.

arista.imagestatus.v1.ComplianceStatus.description:
ComplianceStatus indicates compliance status for software image, terminattr
and extensions.

values.description: values is the mapping of supervisor type to compliance code.

arista.imagestatus.v1.ComplianceStatusBy.description:
ComplianceStatusBySup is a map that indicates the compliance code for each
supervisor.

arista.imagestatus.v1.DiffOp.description:
DiffOp represents the operation performed to get from one side of the diff
to the other.

 - DIFF_OP_UNSPECIFIED: DIFF_OP_UNSPECIFIED indicates op code is unspecified.
 - DIFF_OP_NOP: DIFF_OP_NOP indicates no change.
 - DIFF_OP_ADD: DIFF_OP_ADD is an addition of a software.
 - DIFF_OP_DELETE: DIFF_OP_DELETE is deletion of a software.
 - DIFF_OP_CHANGE: DIFF_OP_CHANGE is an update to the software.

arista.imagestatus.v1.ErrorCode.description:
ErrorCode indicates errors produced during image validations.

 - ERROR_CODE_UNSPECIFIED: ERROR_CODE_UNSPECIFIED indicates error code is unspecified.
 - ERROR_CODE_SUPPORT_NOT_INTRODUCED: ERROR_CODE_SUPPORT_NOT_INTRODUCED represents case where the given EOS version does
not support the SKU.
Deprecated - use ERROR_CODE_EOS_SUPPORT_NOT_INTRODUCED
 - ERROR_CODE_SUPPORT_REMOVED: ERROR_CODE_SUPPORT_REMOVED represents case where the given EOS version no longer
supports the SKU.
Deprecated - use ERROR_CODE_EOS_SUPPORT_REMOVED
 - ERROR_CODE_DEVICE_UNREACHABLE: ERROR_CODE_DEVICE_UNREACHABLE represents the case where the device
is unreachable during a compliance computation.
 - ERROR_CODE_VALIDATION_FAILED: ERROR_CODE_VALIDATION_FAILED represents case where the validations checks
failed.
 - ERROR_CODE_GET_PROPOSED_IMAGE_INFO_FAILED: ERROR_CODE_GET_PROPOSED_IMAGE_INFO_FAILED represents case where we are
unable to get proposed image information for a device.
 - ERROR_CODE_GET_RUNNING_IMAGE_INFO_FROM_ACTIVE_SUPERVISOR_FAILED: ERROR_CODE_GET_RUNNING_IMAGE_INFO_FROM_ACTIVE_SUPERVISOR_FAILED represents case where we
fail to get running image information from an active supervisor.
 - ERROR_CODE_GET_RUNNING_IMAGE_INFO_FROM_PEER_SUPERVISOR_FAILED: ERROR_CODE_GET_RUNNING_IMAGE_INFO_FROM_PEER_SUPERVISOR_FAILED represents case when we
fail to get information from peer supervisor.
 - ERROR_CODE_EOS_TA_ARCHITECTURE_INCOMPATIBLE: ERROR_CODE_EOS_TA_ARCHITECTURE_INCOMPATIBLE represents the case where EOS architecture and
TerminAttr architecture are incompatible.
 - ERROR_CODE_TA_CV_INCOMPATIBLE: ERROR_CODE_TA_CV_INCOMPATIBLE represents the case where TerminAttr is incompatible with
CloudVision; i.e., the TerminAttr version is below CloudVision's minimum supported version.
 - ERROR_CODE_EOS_CV_INCOMPATIBLE: ERROR_CODE_EOS_CV_INCOMPATIBLE represents the case where the EOS version is incompatible with
CloudVision; i.e., the EOS version is outside of CloudVision's supported range of versions.
 - ERROR_CODE_EOS_SUPPORT_NOT_INTRODUCED: ERROR_CODE_EOS_SUPPORT_NOT_INTRODUCED represents the case where the given EOS version does
not support the SKU.
 - ERROR_CODE_EOS_SUPPORT_REMOVED: ERROR_CODE_EOS_SUPPORT_REMOVED represents the case where the given EOS version no longer
supports the SKU.
 - ERROR_CODE_PHYSICAL_DEVICE_EOS_INCOMPATIBLE: ERROR_CODE_PHYSICAL_DEVICE_EOS_INCOMPATIBLE represents the case where the physical device
does not support the given EOS type.
 - ERROR_CODE_TA_EMBEDDEDEXT_INCOMPATIBLE: ERROR_CODE_TA_EMBEDDEDEXT_INCOMPATIBLE represents the case where the extension TerminAttr
version is lower than the embedded TerminAttr version in SWI.
 - ERROR_CODE_DEVICE_EOS_2GB_INCOMPATIBLE: ERROR_CODE_DEVICE_EOS_2GB_INCOMPATIBLE represents the case where a 2GB-device is incompatible
with a non-2GB EOS or a non-2GB device is incompatible with a 2GB-EOS.

name.description: name is the name of the extension.

version.description: version is the version of the extension.

rebootRequired.description:
reboot_required indicates whether applying/deleting this extension
would result in a reboot.

present.description:
present indicates whether the extension is present in the device
or not.

installed.description:
installed indicates whether the extension is installed, not
installed or force installed.

statusDetail.description: status_detail gives the details behind installation of the extension.

isEmbedded.description:
is_embedded indicates whether the extension is embedded in the EOS swi
or not.

arista.imagestatus.v1.Extension.description: Extension provides information of the running/designed extensions.

code.description:
code indicates the operation performed to get from one side of the diff
to the other.

a.description: a is the extension on the a side (left hand side).

b.description: b is the extension on the b side (right hand side).

arista.imagestatus.v1.ExtensionDiff.description: ExtensionDiff is the diff for the running/designed extensions.

values.description: values is an ordered list of extension diffs applied to the device.

arista.imagestatus.v1.ExtensionDiffs.description:
ExtensionDiffs is a list of extension diff information in the order they
will be applied.

values.description: values is the mapping of supervisor type to extension diff.

arista.imagestatus.v1.ExtensionDiffsBySu.description: ExtensionDiffsBySup is the extension diff information for each supervisor.

arista.imagestatus.v1.ExtensionInstallSt.description:
ExtensionInstallStatus indicates whether an extension is installed, not installed
or force installed.

 - EXTENSION_INSTALL_STATUS_UNSPECIFIED: EXTENSION_INSTALL_STATUS_UNSPECIFIED indicates extensions install status is unspecified.
 - EXTENSION_INSTALL_STATUS_NOT_INSTALLED: EXTENSION_INSTALL_STATUS_NOT_INSTALLED indicates extension is not installed on the device.
 - EXTENSION_INSTALL_STATUS_INSTALLED: EXTENSION_INSTALL_STATUS_INSTALLED indicates extension is installed on the device.
 - EXTENSION_INSTALL_STATUS_FORCE_INSTALLED: EXTENSION_INSTALL_STATUS_FORCE_INSTALLED indicates extension is force installed on
device.

sku.description: sku represents the name of the sku.

errorMsg.description: error_msg provides a description of the error.

arista.imagestatus.v1.ImageError.description: ImageError wraps `ErrorCode` enum with a reason string.

values.description: values is a list of image errors.

arista.imagestatus.v1.ImageErrors.description:
ImageErrors is the list of errors reported by CVP when handling image
validations.

sku.description: sku represents the name of the sku.

infoMsg.description: info_msg provides a description of the info.

arista.imagestatus.v1.ImageInfo.description: ImageInfo wraps `InfoCode` enum with a reason string.

values.description: values is a list of image infos.

arista.imagestatus.v1.ImageInfos.description: ImageInfos is the list of info messages reported by CVP when handling image validations.

version.description: version is the version of the EOS image.

release.description: release is the release name of the EOS image.

flavor.description:
flavor is the flavor information of the EOS image.
default flavor is DEFAULT. Other flavors can be DPE, 2GB, etc.

variant.description:
variant is the variant information of the EOS image.
possible values: INT or US.

arch.description: arch is the architecture of the EOS image.

arista.imagestatus.v1.ImageMetadata.description: ImageMetadata provides information regarding the software image.

sku.description: sku indicates the top-level sku or model number.

runningImageUpdateTime.description:
running_image_update_time is the most recent timestamp at which one of
running image side properties is updated.

designedImageUpdateTime.description:
designed_image_update_time is the most recent timestamp at which one of
designed image side properties is updated.

dualSup.description: dual_sup indicates if a device is a dual supervisor.

activeSlot.description:
active_slot indicates the physical slot number for the the active
supervisor.

standbySlot.description:
standby_slot indicates the physical slot number for the standby
supervisor.

softwareImageDiff.description: software_image_diff indicates the image diff for each supervisor.

terminattrDiff.description: terminattr_diff indicates the terminattr diff for each supervisor.

extensionsDiff.description: extensions_diff indicates the extension diff for each supervisor.

complianceStatus.description:
compliance_status is the aggregated compliance status (including both
active/standby and image/TA/extension compliance).

compliance.description: compliance provides compliance information for each supervisor.

rebootRequired.description:
reboot_required indicates whether a reboot is required if the designed
image is pushed to the device.

digest.description:
digest is the digest of the image summary. It can use SHA-256 hash
algorithm for example. It is computed by stringifying the
software_image_diff, terminattr_diff and extensions_diff and computing the
hash.

sku.description: sku represents the name of the sku.

warningMsg.description: warning_msg provides a description of the warning.

arista.imagestatus.v1.ImageWarning.description: ImageWarning wraps `WarningCode` enum with a reason string.

values.description: values is a list of image warnings.

arista.imagestatus.v1.ImageWarnings.description:
ImageWarnings is the list of warnings reported by CVP when handling image
validations.

arista.imagestatus.v1.InfoCode.description:
InfoCode indicates info messages produced during image validations.

 - INFO_CODE_UNSPECIFIED: INFO_CODE_UNSPECIFIED indicates info code is unspecified.
 - INFO_CODE_NEWER_VERSION_AVAILABLE: INFO_CODE_NEWER_VERSION_AVAILABLE represents cases where a newer EOS maintainance
release is available for download.

time.description: Time holds the timestamp of the last item included in the metadata calculation.

type.description:
Operation indicates how the value in this response should be considered.
Under non-subscribe requests, this value should always be INITIAL. In a subscription,
once all initial data is streamed and the client begins to receive modification updates,
you should not see INITIAL again.

count.description: Count is the number of items present under the conditions of the request.

softwareImageRebootRequired.description:
software_image_reboot_required indicates whether reboot is required
for the software image being applied.

terminattrRebootRequired.description:
terminattr_reboot_required indicates whether reboot is required
for the terminattr being applied/deleted.

extensionRebootRequired.description:
extension_reboot_required indicates whether reboot is required
for the extensions being applied/deleted.

arista.imagestatus.v1.RebootRequired.description:
RebootRequired indicates the reboot information per software image,
terminattr and extension for the switch as a whole.

arista.imagestatus.v1.SoftwareCompliance.description:
SoftwareComplianceCode indicates possible compliance status.

 - SOFTWARE_COMPLIANCE_CODE_UNSPECIFIED: SOFTWARE_COMPLIANCE_CODE_UNSPECIFIED indicates compliance code is unspecified.
 - SOFTWARE_COMPLIANCE_CODE_IN_SYNC: SOFTWARE_COMPLIANCE_CODE_IN_SYNC indicates designed and running images/extensions
are identical.
 - SOFTWARE_COMPLIANCE_CODE_OUT_OF_SYNC: SOFTWARE_COMPLIANCE_CODE_OUT_OF_SYNC indicates designed and running images/extensions
are not identical.

name.description: name is the name of the EOS image.

version.description: version is the version of the EOS image.

metadata.description: metadata  is the metadata of EOS image.

arista.imagestatus.v1.SoftwareImage.description: SoftwareImage provides information of the running/designed EOS image.

code.description:
code indicates the operation performed to get from one side of the diff
to the other.

a.description: a is the software image on the a side (left hand side).

b.description: b is the software image on the b side (right hand side).

arista.imagestatus.v1.SoftwareImageDiff.description: SoftwareImageDiff is the diff for the running/designed images.

values.description: values is the mapping of supervisor type to image diff.

arista.imagestatus.v1.SoftwareImageDiffs.description:
SoftwareImageDiffsBySup is software image diff information for each
supervisor.

key.description: key represents the image summary key.

summary.description: summary is the image diff summary.

errors.description:
errors are the image errors encountered while validating the image. These are
displayed on the workspace build results page.

warnings.description:
warnings are the image warnings encountered while validating the image. These are
displayed on the workspace build results page.

infos.description:
infos are the image infos encountered while validating the image. These are
displayed on the workspace build results page.

arista.imagestatus.v1.Summary.description: Summary represents the device image summary.

responses.description:
Values are the values deemed relevant to the initiating request.
The length of this structure is guaranteed to be between (inclusive) 1 and 
min(req.max_messages, INTERNAL_BATCH_LIMIT).

deviceId.title: device_id is the serial number of the device

arista.imagestatus.v1.SummaryKey.description: SummaryKey uniquely identifies a device summary request.

value.description:
Value is the value requested.
This structure will be fully-populated as it exists in the datastore. If
optional fields were not given at creation, these fields will be empty or
set to default values.

time.description:
Time carries the (UTC) timestamp of the last-modification of the
Summary instance in this response.

Time indicates the time for which you are interested in the data.
If no time is given, the server will use the time at which it makes the request.

value.description:
Value is the value requested.
This structure will be fully-populated as it exists in the datastore. If
optional fields were not given at creation, these fields will be empty or
set to default values.

error.description:
Error is an optional field.
It should be filled when there is an error in the GetSome process.

partialEqFilter.description:
PartialEqFilter provides a way to server-side filter a GetAll/Subscribe.
This requires all provided fields to be equal to the response.

While transparent to users, this field also allows services to optimize internal
subscriptions if filter(s) are sufficiently specific.

time.description:
TimeRange allows limiting response data to within a specified time window.
If this field is populated, at least one of the two time fields are required.

For GetAll, the fields start and end can be used as follows:

  * end: Returns the state of each Summary at end.
    * Each Summary response is fully-specified (all fields set).
  * start: Returns the state of each Summary at start, followed by updates until now.
    * Each Summary response at start is fully-specified, but updates may be partial.
  * start and end: Returns the state of each Summary at start, followed by updates
    until end.
    * Each Summary response at start is fully-specified, but updates until end may
      be partial.

This field is not allowed in the Subscribe RPC.

value.description:
Value is a value deemed relevant to the initiating request.
This structure will always have its key-field populated. Which other fields are
populated, and why, depends on the value of Operation and what triggered this notification.

time.description: Time holds the timestamp of this Summary's last modification.

type.description:
Operation indicates how the Summary value in this response should be considered.
Under non-subscribe requests, this value should always be INITIAL. In a subscription,
once all initial data is streamed and the client begins to receive modification updates,
you should not see INITIAL again.

values.description: values is the mapping of supervisor type to terminattr diff.

arista.imagestatus.v1.TerminAttrDiffsByS.description: TerminAttrDiffsBySup is the terminattr diff information for each supervisor.

arista.imagestatus.v1.WarningCode.description:
WarningCode indicates warnings produced during image validations.

 - WARNING_CODE_UNSPECIFIED: WARNING_CODE_UNSPECIFIED indicates warning code is unspecified.
 - WARNING_CODE_NOT_APPLICABLE: WARNING_CODE_NOT_APPLICABLE represents cases where EOS <-> SKU/TA compatibility
is not applicable for non physical switches like vEos.
 - WARNING_CODE_SKUINFO_UNAVAILABLE: WARNING_CODE_SKUINFO_UNAVAILABLE represents case where
information about certain skus is missing.
 - WARNING_CODE_DEVICE_SKU_UNAVAILABLE: WARNING_CODE_DEVICE_SKU_UNAVAILABLE represents unavailability of skus for an EOS Device.
 - WARNING_CODE_SWI_UNKNOWN: WARNING_CODE_SWI_UNKNOWN represents cases where EOS version is not found in release database.
 - WARNING_CODE_TA_EOS_INCOMPATIBLE: WARNING_CODE_TA_EOS_INCOMPATIBLE represents cases where TA and EOS are not compatible.
TA is lower than embedded TA in swi or given TA is unsupported by the EOS.
 - WARNING_CODE_TA_CV_INCOMPATIBLE: WARNING_CODE_TA_CV_INCOMPATIBLE represents cases where TA is incompatible with CV.
TA is lower than minimum supported TA on CV.
Deprecated - use ERROR_CODE_TA_CV_INCOMPATIBLE.
 - WARNING_CODE_EOS_CV_INCOMPATIBLE: WARNING_CODE_EOS_CV_INCOMPATIBLE represents cases where EOS is no longer or not yet
supported by CV. Given EOS is outside range of CV's minimum and maximum EOS.
Deprecated - use ERROR_CODE_EOS_CV_INCOMPATIBLE.
 - WARNING_CODE_EOS_ARCH_UNKNOWN: WARNING_CODE_EOS_ARCH_UNKNOWN represents cases where the specified architecture is
not valid for EOS.
 - WARNING_CODE_TA_EMBEDDEDEXT_INCOMPATIBLE: WARNING_CODE_TA_EMBEDDEDEXT_INCOMPATIBLE represents cases where TA extension is lower
in version than embedded TA in SWI.
 - WARNING_CODE_ARCH_INCOMPATIBLE: WARNING_CODE_ARCH_INCOMPATIBLE represents cases where EOS arch and TA arch are
different. Deprecated.
 - WARNING_CODE_EOS_END_OF_LIFE_DATE_PASSED: WARNING_CODE_EOS_END_OF_LIFE_DATE_PASSED represents cases where the given EOS has passed
its end of life date.
 - WARNING_CODE_SUPPORT_NOT_INTRODUCED: WARNING_CODE_SUPPORT_NOT_INTRODUCED represents cases where the given EOS version does
not support the SKUs.
 - WARNING_CODE_SUPPORT_REMOVED: WARNING_CODE_SUPPORT_REMOVED represents cases where the given EOS version no longer
supports the SKUs.
 - WARNING_CODE_RUNNING_TA_BELOW_MIN_SUPPORTED_VERSION: WARNING_CODE_RUNNING_TA_BELOW_MIN_SUPPORTED_VERSION represents cases where the running
TerminAttr version is below CloudVision's minimum supported version.
 - WARNING_CODE_TA_STUDIO_INCOMPATIBLE: WARNING_CODE_TA_STUDIO_INCOMPATIBLE represents cases where the TerminAttr is incompatible
with Software Management Studio.
 - WARNING_CODE_BUGALERTS_DATA_MISSING: WARNING_CODE_BUGALERTS_DATA_MISSING represents cases where some of the BugAlerts data
under Aeris analytics dataset is missing.

arista.subscriptions.Operation.description:
- INITIAL: INITIAL indicates the associated notification is that of the
current state and a fully-specified Resource is provided.
 - INITIAL_SYNC_COMPLETE: INITIAL_SYNC_COMPLETE indicates all existing-state has been
streamed to the client. This status will be sent in an
otherwise-empty message and no subsequent INITIAL messages
should be expected.
 - UPDATED: UPDATED indicates the associated notification carries
modification to the last-streamed state. This indicates
the contained Resource may be a partial diff, though, it
may contain a fully-specified Resource.
 - DELETED: DETLETED indicates the associated notification carries
a deletion. The Resource's key will always be set in this case,
but no other fields should be expected.
